SEARCH
Package Tekiz._DPSCalculator._DPSCalculator.model.modifiers

Interface Modifier<V>

Type Parameters:
V - The type of value used for the modifier effects, such as Integer or Double.
All Known Implementing Classes:
Consumable, MutationEffects, Perk
public interface Modifier<V>
Represents a generic modifier that can apply effects to a users loadout. This interface defines the core methods required for any modifier to provide its source, condition, and effects.

Modifiers can be perks, consumables, or other types of enhancements that affect various aspects of the users loadout. The actual effects are determined by the implementing class and the type of value used for those effects.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    org.springframework.expression.Expression
    getCondition()
    Retrieves the condition that must be met for the modifier's effects to be applied.
    HashMap<ModifierTypes,V>

    Retrieves the effects associated with the modifier.
    ModifierSource
    getModifierSource()
    Retrieves the source of the modifier, indicating where it originates from (e.g., PERK, CONSUMABLE).

  • Method Details

    • getModifierSource

      ModifierSource getModifierSource()
      Retrieves the source of the modifier, indicating where it originates from (e.g., PERK, CONSUMABLE). This is used by ModifierBoostService to match up the boosts target and modifier source. For example, the Perk "Strange in Numbers" boosts ModifierSource "MUTATION_POSITIVE" by an additional 25% if the conditions are met.
      Returns:
      The source of the modifier, represented by ModifierSource.

    • getCondition

      org.springframework.expression.Expression getCondition()
      Retrieves the condition that must be met for the modifier's effects to be applied. The condition is represented by an Expression, which is evaluated at runtime to determine whether the effects can be used. If the condition is null, it will be assumed that the condition is always met.
      Returns:
      The condition of the modifier as an Expression.

    • getEffects

      HashMap<ModifierTypes,V> getEffects()
      Retrieves the effects associated with the modifier. The effects are defined as a map of ModifierTypes to their corresponding values (Integer, Double or String if the ModifierTypes is "ADDITIONAL_CONTEXT_REQUIRED".)
      Returns:
      A HashMap of ModifierTypes to their corresponding values, where the values are of type V.
